This is a known issue with AWT / SWT Bridge on MacOS. 

Unless all AWT code can be totally stripped out of BIRT, this is not fixable
until the SWT_AWT is implemented/fixed for OSX. The only thing you could try is
-Djava.awt.headless=true as a java vm parameter.

See Bug 67384 for more information.

Ugh. I reluctantly abandoned JChartView because of this issue and turned to 
BIRT because it was an SWT solution. This is listed as being targeted for the 
M2 release. Are you stripping out the AWT code from the Chart Engine?

I really need a cross-platform SWT charting solution, and would love to hear 
that this is going to be resolved in the 2.0 release.

Some looking around, I think it's very doable to get rid of the AWT classes, but
it would require work. 

Note that you cannot even use classes like java.awt.Point on Mac because it
loads the awt dlls (see my Comment 31 on Bug67384), and these are currently used
in the generic parts of chart rendering, but not excessivly.

Here is a list of classes that uses awt in the chart engine (besides the Swing
rendering part of course). I think its doable to get rid of these:

org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine/org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.Object3D.java
     java.awt.geom.Area, java.awt.geom.GeneralPath

org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine/org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.RotatedRectangle.java
     java.awt.Point, java.awt.Polygon

org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine/org.eclipse.birt.chart.computation.withaxes.AutoScale.java
     java.awt.Point

org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine.extension/org.eclipse.birt.chart.rendrer.DialRenderer.java
     java.awt.Rectangle

All, all the AWT codes have been replaced by local implementations in Chart
engine now. Please test and report.
